intro: Collinsia bartsiifolia var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy collinsia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its hairy foliage and showy blooms make it a distinctive and attractive species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and conservation efforts.
